title: How to Make Tamarind Dressing

steps.headline: Soak the tamarind pulp in 1/2 cup warm water.
steps.description: Leave it to soak for about 10 minutes until it softens.

steps.headline: Squeeze the soaked pulp to make a pulped mixture.
Strain it to remove the seeds and fibre.
Stir the smooth pulp together with the orange juice, orange rind, verjuice or vinegar, mirin (if using), mustard and sugar.
Add to salad or provide separately for diners to add to their salad as wished.

text: Soak the tamarind pulp in 1/2 cup warm water. Leave it to soak for about 10 minutes until it softens. Squeeze the soaked pulp to make a pulped mixture.  Strain it to remove the seeds and fibre.  Stir the smooth pulp together with the orange juice, orange rind, verjuice or vinegar, mirin (if using), mustard and sugar.  Mix together well.  Add to salad or provide separately for diners to add to their salad as wished.  Finished.
